content.rendered:
Photo via Unsplash

This Week in Genesis, something big from Diane Kinney & Carrie Dils, Nathan Rice on his approach to developing the Genesis Framework, and a new brand launch by Restored 316.

—

Showcase

Lauren Gaige relaunches her Restored 316 brand and it’s been attracting a lot of praise. And it’s no surprise. Created in collaboration with Melissa Yeager, it’s looking pretty sweet. Check it out now at restored316designs.com

Today, Restored 316 begins a "brand" new journey and we couldn't be more excited! https://t.co/9b8Xt69Owu #genesiswp #wordpress

— Lauren Gaige (@restored316) November 4, 2016

Jesse Petersen with a new homepage for theprairiehomestead.com

Just re-launched the @homesteader homepage with a #mobilefirst #genesiswp design and code. Hope y’all like it. https://t.co/62OhzhUQIR

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) November 2, 2016

CueFox relaunched their website and it’s looking good, cuefox.com

We are excited about our new #website that we have just launched! #WordPress #genesiswp #WebDesign #Graphicshttps://t.co/nsGWct5lSa

— CueFox (@CueFoxCreative) November 2, 2016

Neil Gee for websitelove.com.au

Launching some love with WebsiteLove #genesiswp https://t.co/O4iMiEPybu pic.twitter.com/Uje9q8gb5d

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) November 4, 2016

Claire with a redesign for thenerdculture.com

Project showcase: Website Design + Ecommerce For The Nerd Culture https://t.co/016qADqMif #genesiswp

— Claire / W&P (@wildflowerspix) October 30, 2016

46digital for juliencahn.com.au

New site launch for #SunshineCoast coast life coach @juliencahn – https://t.co/fdNI7wsCZG #WordPress #genesiswp

— 46digital marketing (@46digital) November 1, 2016

Justin McGuire, with not one, not two but three new Genesis sites, http://winnerregional.org, http://riverpointemoorhead.com, and http://unitedcapmn.org

Cranking out the hits this week with another great site from #TeamVivid! https://t.co/sDKbeUuY9x #GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/UQ0BU9G17t

— Justin McGuire (@jemcgui) November 4, 2016

What!? Another site from #TeamVivid? Yep! https://t.co/EHJVAwavrP #GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/C0mwJ8BU0M

— Justin McGuire (@jemcgui) November 3, 2016

Happy to announce the launch of the new website for https://t.co/twLRGWctHY! #GenesisWP #TeamVivid pic.twitter.com/eQoSHGVkA9

— Justin McGuire (@jemcgui) November 2, 2016

Podcasts

On StudioPress.fm this week, Lauren and Brian chat to Bill Kenney on leveraging social media to build a creative brand.

New Episode! Leveraging Social Media to Build a Creative Brand — https://t.co/XqdGcAUJt5 with @BillSKenney pic.twitter.com/ozlEuTsJ5I

— StudioPress (@studiopress) November 2, 2016

Jackie D’Elia has a great guest this week on rethink.fm, web accessibility expert Rian Rietveld.

Ep 7: Why Web Accessibility Matters with @RianRietveld #a11y #WordPress https://t.co/nf6t5ep85b pic.twitter.com/gvvY0G9cgS

— Rethink FM (@rethinkfm) November 2, 2016

While, over on OfficeHours.fm, Carrie’s back for a new season, chatting to Diane Kinney, Matt Medeiros and Rebecca Gill.

Tonight we’re LIVE with Season 3! Join me, @dkinney, @mattmedeiros, and @rebeccagill at 8pET. https://t.co/NIxHKWKIci pic.twitter.com/tW76APudI0

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) November 3, 2016

Best of the rest

Some interesting insight from Genesis lead developer, Nathan Rice on his approach to developing the Genesis Framework (and his thoughts on the latest Apple announcement 🙂 ).

Apple seems to be inexplicably obsessed with the thinness of their devices, at the expense of more important things.

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) November 1, 2016

I have a little experience with getting obsessed about unimportant things. In the early days of #GenesisWP, I wanted it to be the fastest …

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) November 1, 2016

WordPress theme framework available. For a while, it was. But eventually, I realized usable features were more important.

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) November 1, 2016

The fastest theme had 0 features, no added functionality over a standard theme. So we deprioritized speed for more useful stuff.

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) November 1, 2016

#GenesisWP is still really fast. But we don’t sacrifice a feature for 3ms of speed improvement. It’s not worth it.

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) November 1, 2016

After the launch last week, v1.0.3 of Local Business Pro is now available from Jamie Mitchell. Featuring extra sections on the home page and a new before header widget.

V1.0.3 of Local Business Pro now available, extra sections on home page + before header widget added. https://t.co/mDLKvpFjL0 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/25bkVZwcV4

— Jamie Mitchell (@jamiejmitchell) November 2, 2016

And he’s already working on his second theme too…

Starting on my second #genesiswp theme this morning…stay tuned 🙂

— Jamie Mitchell (@jamiejmitchell) October 30, 2016

Robin Cornett with a nice tutorial (and rundown of the options) for hiding / removing archive headlines in Genesis.

How to Hide/Remove Archive Headlines in Genesis https://t.co/6RRMZdBwKT via @robincornett <- Lots of ways hide archive headings #GenesisWP

— Marcy Diaz (@mjsdiaz1) November 1, 2016

Because if you ask…

Is there an easy way of getting #genesiswp simple sidebar to work with custom taxonomy? Doesn’t appear in archive settings by default.. 🙁

— Dave Browne (@yivva) October 31, 2016

…Sridhar Katakam will often help, this time with a tutorial on adding support for Genesis Simple Sidebar Options to a custom Taxonomy term archive.

Adding support for Genesis Simple Sidebar Options to a custom Taxonomy term archive:https://t.co/2z5mjXvRas#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/xesGzq3oAm

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) October 31, 2016

Omar Al-Ansari with a second approach to his tutorial from last week on creating a timeline in Genesis using Advanced Custom Fields PRO.

Timeline In #Genesis Using ACF Pro – A Second Optionhttps://t.co/KS7Hpz3zO9#GenesisWP #WordPress #ACFPro #advancedCustomFields pic.twitter.com/HjlQjhpQiP

— Omar Al-Ansari (@oalansari82) October 31, 2016

Chris Ford has a tutorial on using Typekit in Design Palette for Genesis.

Just posted a tutorial on using Typekit in @DesignPalette for #genesiswp:https://t.co/8POsV427PZ pic.twitter.com/b1IE1Gw6fd

— Chris Ford (@ci_chrisford) November 4, 2016

And finally…

Something for all you freelancing, consulting and web developing folk out there…

A brand new book from Carrie Dils and Diane Kinney, entitled Real World Freelancing.

Given the experience and knowledge of these two ladies, I can only imagine the ROI on this thing is going to be big.

So if you’re interested, go drop your email address at realworldfreelancing.com and you can be sure to hear more, very soon

The Real World Freelancing book site got an update this week. Built with #genesiswp and @BeaverBuilder : https://t.co/UjYB0pUSUd pic.twitter.com/sbK5EKqhmM

— Diane Kinney (@dkinney) October 30, 2016

—

That’s all for this week. I’ll be back soon, hopefully next week. Hopefully on time, possibly not.

Until then, if you love This Week in Genesis as much as I enjoy writing it, I’d love love love it if you subscribe below.

You won’t get spammed, you’ll just get great Genesis related content in your inbox semi-regularly (and who doesn’t want that).

Have a great week!

excerpt.rendered: Something big from Diane Kinney & Carrie Dils, Nathan Rice on his approach to developing the Genesis Framework, and a new brand launch by Restored 316.
